To:  . . . I swear, I am not unhappy or meaning to come off sounding like an"ingrate". I want to ask if there is ANYWAY POSSIBLE, to re-convert this movie EXACTLY as you did with one difference. PLEASE set the frame rate to 30 fps. Because you have it set at 23.98, it causes a "HICK-UP" effect every few seconds of viewing. Maybe others are not having this issue but I tried watching it using VLC, QUICKTIME PRO vs 7.x , a media viewer written in DARWIN specifically ported for Mac (and does everything VLC and QUICKTIME does and uses many of the same codecs found in the QUICKTIME app.) I would look at my own software/hardware as the problem. but I have a copy of the recently released PREDATORS (w/ Adrian Broody. . . Why he's was cast as a "tough guy" is a mystery to me but he did ok?.?) ANYWAY, it is also put into a MP4 cont w/H264 video and AC3 audio, and this problem doesn't occur. I was confused to what the difference was, it made no sense. So, using QUICKTIME PRO, it allows you to get a report on all the details of any given movie you load. When comparing the data between the 2 movies that seemed to be made or converted from the original BRDVD in the exact same way, I noticed that the only difference was the FRAME RATE. The PREDATORS film was converted to 30 FPS (not 29.98 which may or may not have been fine w/ my various media players) and this movie -THE ISLAND- was converted ( as you know at 23.98fps ) You have it on your info below as 24 fps | and yes-It makes a major difference. Is there ANYWAY you could upload a copy with a higher frame rate rather then a fractional frame rate? I really do appreciate your time. Thanks, sincerely, DM
